metadata.title: CVE-2022-30556 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Apache HTTP Server 2.4.53 and earlier may return lengths to applicationscalling r:wsread() that point past the end of the storage allocated for thebuffer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-30556` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24').
